citation: Justice Miscellaneous (Removal of Outdated Sex Terminology) Act 2023 (Tas)
text:
Justice Miscellaneous (Removal of Outdated Sex Terminology) Act 2023

An Act to amend the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998, the Court Security Act 2017, the Public Trustee Act 1930 and the Youth Justice Act 1997
[Royal Assent 21 September 2023]

Be it enacted by Her Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

PART 1 - Preliminary

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Justice Miscellaneous (Removal of Outdated Sex Terminology) Act 2023 .

2. Commencement
    This Act commences on the day on which this Act receives the Royal Assent.

3. Repeal of Act
    This Act is repealed on the first anniversary of the day on which it commenced.

PART 2 - Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 Amended

4.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 .

5.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 .

6.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 .

7.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 .

8.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1998 .

PART 3 - Court Security Act 2017 Amended

9.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Court Security Act 2017 .

10.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Court Security Act 2017 .

PART 4 - Public Trustee Act 1930 Amended

11.

PART 5 - Youth Justice Act 1997 Amended

13.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Youth Justice Act 1997 .
